enWisdom: One who prevents righteousness is deprived of gratitude

Wisdom: احْذَرُوا الشُّحَّ فَإِنَّهُ يَكْسِبُ الْمَقْتَ وَيَشِينُ الْمَحَاسِنَ وَيُشِيعُ الْعُيُوبَ
enWisdom: Be wary of avarice, for verily it brings hate, tarnishes [one’s] good qualities and exposes [one’s] faults

Wisdom: إِيَّاكُمْ وَالْبُخْلَ فَإِنَّ الْبَخِيلَ يَمْقَتُهُ الْغَرِيبُ وَيَنْفُرُ مِنْهُ الْقَرِيبُ
enWisdom: I bid you to refrain from stinginess, for the miser is hated by strangers and shunned by those who are close to him

Wisdom: زِيَادَةُ الشُّحِّ تَشِينُ الْفُتُوَّةَ وَتُفْسِدُ الْأُخُوَّةَ
enWisdom: Excessive avarice sullies chivalry and spoils brotherhood

Wisdom: مَنْعُ خَيْرِكَ يَدْعُو إِلَى صُحْبَةِ غَيْرِكَ
enWisdom: Holding back your kindness invites [your companions] to accompany someone other than you
There is no alienation like avarice
